resourceProperties.description: This property provides a performance directive that affects the internal semantics of the input data type conversion capability of the driver. By default the Universal driver defers 'internal prepare requests'. In this case, the driver works without the benefit of described parameter or result set meta data until execute time. So undescsribed input data is sent 'as is' to the server without any data type cross-conversation of the inputs.

resourceProperties.name: currentSchema
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the default schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references where applicable in dynamically prepared SQL statements. Unless currentSchema is used, the default schema name is the authorization id of the current session user.

resourceProperties.name: cliSchema
resourceProperties.description: Indicates the schema of the DB2 shadow catalog tables or views to search when you issue a database meta data catalog query.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: clientAccountingInformation
resourceProperties.description: Specifies accounting information for the current client for the connection. This information is for client accounting purposes. This value can change during a connection. For a DB2 UDB for Linux, UNIX and Windows server, the maximum length is 255 bytes. A Java empty string is valid for this value, but a Java null value is not valid.

resourceProperties.name: clientApplicationInformation
resourceProperties.description: Specifies application information for the current client for the connection. This information is for client accounting purposes. This value can change during a connection. For a DB2 UDB for Linux, UNIX and Windows server, the maximum length is 255 bytes. A Java empty string is valid for this value, but a Java null value is not valid.

resourceProperties.name: clientUser
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the current client user name for the connection. This information is for client accounting purposes. Unlike the JDBC connection user name, this value can change during a connection. For a DB2 UDB for Linux, UNIX and Windows server, the maximum length is 255 bytes.

resourceProperties.name: clientWorkstation
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the workstation name for the current client for the connection. This information is for client accounting purposes. This value can change during a connection. For a DB2 UDB for Linux, UNIX and Windows server, the maximum length is 255 bytes. A Java empty string is valid for this value, but a Java null value is not valid.

resourceProperties.name: currentPackagePath
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of collections on the server. If this property is specified, the currentPackageSet property is ignored.

resourceProperties.name: currentSQLID
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the default schema name that is used to qualify unqualified database objects in dynamically prepared SQL statements. This value of this property sets the value in the CURRENT SQLID special register on a DB2 UDB for OS/390 or z/OS server. If the currentSQLID property is not set, the default schema name is the value in the CURRENT SQLID special register.

resourceProperties.name: kerberosServerPrincipal
resourceProperties.description: For a data source that uses Kerberos security, specifies the name that is used for the data source when it is registered with the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). It should be of the format user@realm.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time in seconds to wait for the DataSource object to connect to a data source. A value of 0 means that the timeout value is the default system timeout value.

resourceProperties.name: securityMechanism
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the DRDA security mechanism. Possible values are: 3 (CLEAR_TEXT_PASSWORD_SECURITY), 4 (USER_ONLY_SECURITY), 7 (ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD_SECURITY), 9 (ENCRYPTED_USER_AND_PASSWORD_SECURITY), or 11 (KERBEROS_SECURITY). Plesae refer to DB2 manual for the constant value. If this property is specified, the specified security mechanism is the only mechanism that is used. If no value is specified for this property, 3 is used.

resourceProperties.name: currentFunctionPath
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the value for the CURRENT FUNCTION PATH special register of the DB2 server.

resourceProperties.name: cursorSensitivity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether java.sql.ResultSet.TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE maps to sensitive dynamic or sensitive static scroll. This property is ignored for insensitive scrollable cursors. The default is 0 (TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE_STATIC). Alternatively, it can be set to 1 (TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE_DYNAMIC) to have TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE cursors map to sensitive dynamic cursors or set to 2 (TYPE_SCROLL_ASENSITIVE) to use SENSITIVE whenever possible, otherwise, fallback to INSENSITIVE when the request doesn't support SENSITIVE.

resourceProperties.name: keepDynamic
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether DB2 keeps dynamic SQL statements after commit points. This is applicable only when the target server is DB2 for z/OS. The property default depends on the server. Specifying 1 means YES, DB2 keeps dynamic SQL statements after commit points. Specifying 2 means NO, DB2 does not keep dynamic SQL statements after commit points. If this property is not set defaults are assumed. If the JDBC package set is custom bound without these defaults, this property must be set. The driver has no way to know how custom JDBC packages were bound under current DRDA architecture. This property is not a directive to server, but rather a driver directive.

resourceProperties.name: useTransactionRedirect
resourceProperties.description: Configure this property if your backend uses the Database Partitioning Feature (DPF) and your partitioning key remains constant throughout a transaction. This property is only valid when configuring the XA datasource with Type 4

resourceProperties.name: activateDatabase
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: activateDatabase

resourceProperties.name: alternateGroupDatabaseName
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the database names for alternative data sharing groups to which an application can connect.

resourceProperties.name: alternateGroupPortNumber
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the port numbers for alternative data sharing groups to which an application can connect.

resourceProperties.name: alternateGroupServerName
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the host names for alternative data sharing groups to which an application can connect.

resourceProperties.name: connectionCloseWithInFlightTransaction
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ throws an SQLException or rolls back a transaction without throwing an SQLException when a connection is closed in the middle of the transaction.

resourceProperties.name: currentAlternateGroupEntry
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: currentAlternateGroupEntry

resourceProperties.name: enableAlternateGroupSeamlessACR
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether failover to an alternate group is seamless or non-seamless.

resourceProperties.name: enableExtendedDescribe
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: enableExtendedDescribe

resourceProperties.name: enableExtendedIndicators
resourceProperties.description: Enables the use of default and unassigned indicators as parameters.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeInputStreamsOnBatchExecution
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: fullyMaterializeInputStreamsOnBatchExecution

resourceProperties.name: implicitRollbackOption
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the actions that the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ takes when a transaction encounters a deadlock or a timeout.

resourceProperties.name: interruptProcessingMode
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the behavior of the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ when an application calls the Statement.cancel method.

resourceProperties.name: keepAliveTimeOut
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum time in seconds before an unresponsive connection is detected as no longer alive.

resourceProperties.name: maxConnCachedParamBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum size of an internal buffer that is used for caching input parameter values for PreparedStatement objects.

resourceProperties.name: profileName
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: profileName

resourceProperties.name: queryTimeoutInterruptProcessingMode
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ cancels the SQL statement or closes the underlying connection when the query timeout interval for a Statement object expires.

resourceProperties.name: recordTemporalHistory
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: recordTemporalHistory

resourceProperties.name: sessionTimeZone
resourceProperties.description: Sets the time zone at session level on the server.

resourceProperties.name: sqljCloseStmtsWithOpenResultSet
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: sqljCloseStmtsWithOpenResultSet

resourceProperties.name: sqljEnableClassLoaderSpecificProfiles
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM DB2 Driver for JDBC and SQLJ allows using and loading of SQLJ profiles with the same Java name in multiple J2EE application (.ear) files.

resourceProperties.name: stripTrailingZerosForDecimalNumbers
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ removes trailing zeroes when it retrieves data from a DECFLOAT, DECIMAL, or NUMERIC column as a java.math.BigDecimal object.

resourceProperties.name: timerLevelForQueryTimeOut
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the level at which the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ creates a java.util.Timer object for waiting for query execution to time out.

resourceProperties.name: traceFileCount
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum number of trace files, for circular tracing.

resourceProperties.name: traceFileSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum size of each trace file, for circular tracing.

resourceProperties.name: traceOption
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether sequential tracing or circular tracing is done.

resourceProperties.name: translateForBitData
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: translateForBitData

resourceProperties.name: updateCountForBatch
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver property: updateCountForBatch

resourceProperties.name: useIdentityValLocalForAutoGeneratedKeys
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ uses only the SQL built-in function IDENTITY_VAL_LOCAL to determine automatically generated key values.

resourceProperties.name: clientRerouteServerListJNDIName
resourceProperties.description: The name used to bind the DB2 client reroute server list to JNDI name space.

resourceProperties.name: retryIntervalForClientReroute
resourceProperties.description: The amount of time (in seconds) between automatic client reroute retries. This property is only used if the maxRetriesForClientReroute property is also set.

resourceProperties.name: maxRetriesForClientReroute
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of connection retries attempted by automatic client reroute if the primary connection to the server fails. This property is only used if the retryIntervalClientReroute property is also set.

resourceProperties.name: enableClientAffinitiesList
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ enables client affinities for cascaded failover support. Possible values are: 1 (enabled), 2 (disabled). Disabled is the default when no value is specified.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: propagateClientIdentityUsingTrustedContext
resourceProperties.description: Enable the propagation of client identity using DB2 Trusted Context. The resource reference must be configured with trusted connections authentication for this setting to take affect.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resourceProperties.name: enableClientInformation
resourceProperties.description: Enables the implicit passing of client information on database connections. The client information provided on each connection is the same as for the WAS.clientinfo trace group. Whereas the WAS.clientinfo trace is configured on an application server, the enableClientInformation property applies to a data source configuration.

resourceProperties.name: unbindClientRerouteListFromJndi
resourceProperties.description: Used with testConnection only. When set to true, clientRerouteServerListJNDIName will be unbound from JNDI name space when performing testConnection.

resourceProperties.name: clientRerouteAlternateServerName
resourceProperties.description: The list of alternate server name(s) for the DB2 server. If more than one alternate server name is specified, then the names must be separated by a comma. For example, host1,host2.

resourceProperties.name: clientRerouteAlternatePortNumber
resourceProperties.description: The list of alternate server port(s) for the DB2 server. If more than one alternate server port is specified, then the ports must be separated by a comma. For example, 5000,50001.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - DB2 JDBC2-compliant Provider

factories.name: DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver - 4.0 DataSource
factories.providerType: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - DB2 Datasource

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionAttribute
resourceProperties.description: The connection attributes. Refer to the DB2 reference for the list of connection attributes.

factories.name: DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver DataSource
factories.providerType: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - DB2 Datasource

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to jdbc:db2:sample.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionAttribute
resourceProperties.description: The connection attributes. Refer to the DB2 reference for the list of connection attributes.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - DB2 JDBC2-compliant Provider

factories.name: DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.providerType: DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 Legacy CLI-based JDBC Driver - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - DB2 Datasource

resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionAttribute
resourceProperties.description: The connection attributes. Refer to the DB2 reference for the list of connection attributes.

To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - maxVer null - IBM Developer Kit for Java JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries. This driver is not recommended for remote access. The location of the jar file on a V7 or later node is /QIBM/Proddata/java400/jdk6/lib/ext/db2_classes16.jar. The location of the jar file on a V6 or earlier node is /QIBM/ProdData/Java400/ext/db2_classes.jar.

factories.name: DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native) - 4.0 DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native) - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: New DB2 Datasource

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This property specifies the database to which the DataSource attempts to connect. The default is *LOCAL. The database name must either exist in the relational database directory on the system that runs the application or be the special value *LOCAL or localhost to specify the local system. Additionally, a default collection name may be specified by entering this property value in the format of '*LOCAL/(collectionName)' Where '*LOCAL' represents the name or the database to which the DataSource attempts to connect and '(collectionName)' represents the name of the of the collection to be searched for any unqualified table names that appear in SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: access
resourceProperties.description: This value can be used to restrict the type of operations that can be done with a specific connection. The default value is 'all' and basically means that the connection has full access to the JDBC API. The 'read call' value allows the connection to do only queries and call stored procedures. An attempt to update the database through an SQL statement will be stopped. The 'read only' value can be used to restrict a connection to only queries. Stored procedure calls and update statements will be stopped.

resourceProperties.name: batchStyle
resourceProperties.description: The JDBC 2.1 specification defines a second method for how exceptions in a batch update can be handled. The driver can comply with either of these. The default is to work as defined in the JDBC 2.0 specification. The possible values are : 2.0, 2.1.

resourceProperties.name: blockSize
resourceProperties.description: This is the number of rows that will be fetched at a time for a result set. For typical forward only processing of a result set, a block of this size will be obtained.

resourceProperties.name: cursorHold
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether or not ResultSets should remain open when a transaction is committed. A value of true means that an application is able to access its open ResultSets after commit is called. A value of false means that commit will close any open cursors under the Connection. The default default for WebSphere is false. This value property serves as a default value for all ResultSets made for the Connection. With cursor holdability support added in JDBC 3.0, this default is simply replaced if an application specifies a different holdability later.

resourceProperties.name: dataTruncation
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether truncation of character data should cause warnings and exceptions to be generated (true) or if the data should just be silently truncated (false). The default is true, data truncation of character fields should be honored.

resourceProperties.name: dateFormat
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of how dates will be formatted. The possible values are : julian, mdy, dmy, ymd, usa, iso, eur, jis.

resourceProperties.name: dateSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the date separator will be. This is only valid in combination with some of the dateFormat values (per system rules). The possible values are: / - . , b

resourceProperties.name: decimalSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the decimal separator should be. The possible values are: '. ,'

resourceProperties.name: doEscapeProcessing
resourceProperties.description: This property sets a flag for whether or not statements under the connection must do escape processing. Using escape processing is a way to code your SQL statements so that they are generic and similar for all platforms, but then the database reads the escape clauses and substitutes the proper system specific version for the user. The default value for this property is true, as it must be to be compliant with the JDBC specification (escape processing is active by default - see the setEscapeProcessing method of the statement interface for more details).

resourceProperties.name: fullErrors
resourceProperties.description: Allows second-level error text the full system to be returned in SQLException object messages.

resourceProperties.name: libraries
resourceProperties.description: This property allows a list of libraries to be placed into the server job's library list or a specific default library to be set. The list of libraries can be seperated by spaces, colons or commas. The naming property affects how this property works. In the default case, where naming is set to 'sql', the library list has no effect on how the connection processes. There is a default library for all unqualified tables. By default, that library has the same name as the user profile that is connected. If the libraries property is specified, the first library in the list becomes the default library. If a default library is specified on the databaseName property (as in '*LOCAL/mylibrary'), that overrides any value in this property. In the case where naming is set to 'system', each of the libraries specified for this property is added to the user's library list and the library list is searched to resolve unqualified table references.

resourceProperties.name: lobThreshold
resourceProperties.description: Tells the driver to place the actual values into the ResultSet storage instead of locators for lob columns if the lob column is smaller than the threshold size.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: prefetch
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether or not the driver should fetch the first data for a ResultSet immediately after execution or wait until the data is requested. Default is true.

resourceProperties.name: reuseObjects
resourceProperties.description: Specified whether or not the driver should attempt to reuse some types of objects after the user closes them. This is a performance enhancement. The default is true.

resourceProperties.name: serverTraceCategories
resourceProperties.description: This property enables tracing of the JDBC server job. If server tracing is enabled, tracing starts when the client connects to the server, and ends when the connection is disconnected. Trace data is collected in spooled files on the server. Multiple levels of server tracing can be turned on in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the set method. Note: This property is typically used by support personnel and its values are not discussed further.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future use.

resourceProperties.name: timeFormat
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of how time values will be formatted. The possible values are: hms, usa, iso, eur, jis

resourceProperties.name: timeSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the time separator will be. This is only valid in combination with some of the timeFormat values (per system rules). The possible values are: : . , b

resourceProperties.name: trace
resourceProperties.description: This property allows for turning on tracing of the connection. It can be used as a simple debugging aide. The default value is false, do not use tracing. WARNING - when a value is defined for this property a JVM variable will be set. Multiple datasources with this property set to different values will conflict and the result is unpredictable.

resourceProperties.name: translateBinary
resourceProperties.description: This property can be used to force the JDBC driver to treat binary and varbinary data values as if they where char and varchar data values. The default for this property is false, binary data is not treat the same as character data.

resourceProperties.name: useBlockInsert
resourceProperties.description: This property allows the Native JDBC driver to go into a block insert mode for inserting blocks of data into the database. This is an optimized version of the batch update. This optimized mode can only be used in applications that ensure that the do not break certain system constraints or data insert failures and potentially even data corruption can occur. The default is false.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: systemNaming
resourceProperties.description: Allows user to specify whether collections and tables should be separated by a period(SQL naming) or a slash(system naming). This property also determines whether a default library is used (SQL naming) or the library list is used (system naming). The default is SQL naming

resourceProperties.name: behaviorOverride
resourceProperties.description: Sets the Native JDBC Driver behaviors to override. Multiple behaviors can be changed in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the this method. Carefully consider the result of overriding the default behavior of the driver. For example, setting the value of this property to 1 means the driver will no longer thrown an exception if Statement.executeQuery() or PreparedStatement.executeQuery() do not return a result set. The driver will instead return null for the result set, even though the JDBC 3.0 specification states throwing an exception is the correct behavior. Be sure your application correctly handles the altered behavior.

resourceProperties.name: maximumScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. The value can range from 0 to the maximum precision. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: maximumPrecision
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum precision (length) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. Valid values are 31 or 63. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: minimumDivideScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the minimum divide scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for both intermediary and result data types. The value can range from 0 to 9, not to exceed the maximum scale. If 0 is specified, minimum divide scale is not used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: translateHex
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type used by hex constants in SQL expressions. The possible values are 'binary, and 'character'. The binary setting indicates that hex contants will use the BINARY data type, which is new for V5R3. The character setting indicates that hex contants will use the CHARACTER FOR BIT DATA data type. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: cursorSensitivity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the type of cursors to be returned when sensitive cursors are requested. The default behavior is to return asensitive cursors. A setting of 'sensitive' will cause sensitive instead of asensitive cursors to be opened when ResultSet.TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE is used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: directMap
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, the native JDBC driver will use the database server's ability to directly fetch rows of data into a buffer. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.

resourceProperties.name: queryOptimizeGoal
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is '2'. This property specifies the query optimization goal used by the database server. A value of 1 indicates that '*FIRSTIO' should be used. For '*FIRSTIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of returning the first page of output as fast as possible. A value of 2 indicates that '*ALLIO' should be used. For '*ALLIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of running the entire query to completion in the shortest amount of elapsed time. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.

resourceProperties.name: commitHold
resourceProperties.description: This value specifies whether 'commit hold' is used when the connection.commit() methods is called. When 'commit hold' is used, cursors and other database resources are not closed or freed when commit is called. This property is valid for V6R1 and later.

factories.name: DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native) DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native) DataSource
factories.description: New JDBC Datasource

resourceProperties.name: libraries
resourceProperties.description: This property allows a list of libraries to be placed into the server job's library list or a specific default library to be set. The list of libraries can be seperated by spaces, colons or commas. The naming property affects how this property works. In the default case, where naming is set to 'sql', the library list has no effect on how the connection processes. There is a default library for all unqualified tables. By default, that library has the same name as the user profile that is connected. If the libraries property is specified, the first library in the list becomes the default library. If a default library is specified on the databaseName property (as in '*LOCAL/mylibrary'), that overrides any value in this property. In the case where naming is set to 'system', each of the libraries specified for this property is added to the user's library list and the library list is searched to resolve unqualified table references.

resourceProperties.name: lobThreshold
resourceProperties.description: Tells the driver to place the actual values into the ResultSet storage instead of locators for lob columns if the lob column is smaller than the threshold size.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: prefetch
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether or not the driver should fetch the first data for a ResultSet immediately after execution or wait until the data is requested. Default is true.

resourceProperties.name: reuseObjects
resourceProperties.description: Specified whether or not the driver should attempt to reuse some types of objects after the user closes them. This is a performance enhancement. The default is true.

resourceProperties.name: serverTraceCategories
resourceProperties.description: This property enables tracing of the JDBC server job. If server tracing is enabled, tracing starts when the client connects to the server, and ends when the connection is disconnected. Trace data is collected in spooled files on the server. Multiple levels of server tracing can be turned on in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the set method. Note: This property is typically used by support personnel and its values are not discussed further.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future use.

resourceProperties.name: timeFormat
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of how time values will be formatted. The possible values are: hms, usa, iso, eur, jis

resourceProperties.name: timeSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the time separator will be. This is only valid in combination with some of the timeFormat values (per system rules). The possible values are: : . , b

resourceProperties.name: trace
resourceProperties.description: This property allows for turning on tracing of the connection. It can be used as a simple debugging aide. The default value is false, do not use tracing. WARNING - when a value is defined for this property a JVM variable will be set. Multiple datasources with this property set to different values will conflict and the result is unpredictable.

resourceProperties.name: translateBinary
resourceProperties.description: This property can be used to force the JDBC driver to treat binary and varbinary data values as if they where char and varchar data values. The default for this property is false, binary data is not treat the same as character data.

resourceProperties.name: useBlockInsert
resourceProperties.description: This property allows the Native JDBC driver to go into a block insert mode for inserting blocks of data into the database. This is an optimized version of the batch update. This optimized mode can only be used in applications that ensure that the do not break certain system constraints or data insert failures and potentially even data corruption can occur. The default is false.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: systemNaming
resourceProperties.description: Allows user to specify whether collections and tables should be separated by a period(SQL naming) or a slash(system naming). This property also determines whether a default library is used (SQL naming) or the library list is used (system naming). The default is SQL naming

resourceProperties.name: behaviorOverride
resourceProperties.description: Sets the Native JDBC Driver behaviors to override. Multiple behaviors can be changed in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the this method. Carefully consider the result of overriding the default behavior of the driver. For example, setting the value of this property to 1 means the driver will no longer thrown an exception if Statement.executeQuery() or PreparedStatement.executeQuery() do not return a result set. The driver will instead return null for the result set, even though the JDBC 3.0 specification states throwing an exception is the correct behavior. Be sure your application correctly handles the altered behavior.

resourceProperties.name: autoCommit
resourceProperties.description: When set to true, this property causes the data source to always create connections with auto-commit on. Setting this property to true causes the data source to create connections with auto-commit on when using a transaction isolation level other than 'none'. The default value for this property to 'true'. This property is ignored when the transaction isolation level is set to 'none'.

resourceProperties.name: maximumScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. The value can range from 0 to the maximum precision. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: maximumPrecision
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum precision (length) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. Valid values are 31 or 63. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: minimumDivideScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the minimum divide scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for both intermediary and result data types. The value can range from 0 to 9, not to exceed the maximum scale. If 0 is specified, minimum divide scale is not used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: translateHex
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type used by hex constants in SQL expressions. The possible values are 'binary, and 'character'. The binary setting indicates that hex contants will use the BINARY data type, which is new for V5R3. The character setting indicates that hex contants will use the CHARACTER FOR BIT DATA data type. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: cursorSensitivity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the type of cursors to be returned when sensitive cursors are requested. The default behavior is to return asensitive cursors. A setting of 'sensitive' will cause sensitive instead of asensitive cursors to be opened when ResultSet.TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE is used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: directMap
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, the native JDBC driver will use the database server's ability to directly fetch rows of data into a buffer. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.

resourceProperties.name: queryOptimizeGoal
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is '2'. This property specifies the query optimization goal used by the database server. A value of 1 indicates that '*FIRSTIO' should be used. For '*FIRSTIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of returning the first page of output as fast as possible. A value of 2 indicates that '*ALLIO' should be used. For '*ALLIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of running the entire query to completion in the shortest amount of elapsed time. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.

resourceProperties.name: commitHold
resourceProperties.description: This value specifies whether 'commit hold' is used when the connection.commit() methods is called. When 'commit hold' is used, cursors and other database resources are not closed or freed when commit is called. This property is valid for V6R1 and later.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - maxVer null - IBM Developer Kit for Java XA-compliant JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries. This driver is not recommended for remote access. The location of the jar file on a V7 or later node is /QIBM/Proddata/java400/jdk6/lib/ext/db2_classes16.jar. The location of the jar file on a V6 or earlier node is /QIBM/ProdData/Java400/ext/db2_classes.jar.

factories.name: DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native XA) - 4.0 DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DB2 UDB for iSeries (Native XA) - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: New DB2 Datasource

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This property specifies the database to which the DataSource attempts to connect. The default is *LOCAL. The database name must either exist in the relational database directory on the system that runs the application or be the special value *LOCAL or localhost to specify the local system. Additionally, a default collection name may be specified by entering this property value in the format of '*LOCAL/(collectionName)' Where '*LOCAL' represents the name or the database to which the DataSource attempts to connect and '(collectionName)' represents the name of the of the collection to be searched for any unqualified table names that appear in SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: access
resourceProperties.description: This value can be used to restrict the type of operations that can be done with a specific connection. The default value is 'all' and basically means that the connection has full access to the JDBC API. The 'read call' value allows the connection to do only queries and call stored procedures. An attempt to update the database through an SQL statement will be stopped. The 'read only' value can be used to restrict a connection to only queries. Stored procedure calls and update statements will be stopped.

resourceProperties.name: batchStyle
resourceProperties.description: The JDBC 2.1 specification defines a second method for how exceptions in a batch update can be handled. The driver can comply with either of these. The default is to work as defined in the JDBC 2.0 specification. The possible values are : 2.0, 2.1.

resourceProperties.name: blockSize
resourceProperties.description: This is the number of rows that will be fetched at a time for a result set. For typical forward only processing of a result set, a block of this size will be obtained.

resourceProperties.name: cursorHold
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether or not ResultSets should remain open when a transaction is committed. A value of true means that an application is able to access its open ResultSets after commit is called. A value of false means that commit will close any open cursors under the Connection. The default for WebSphere is false. This value property serves as a default value for all ResultSets made for the Connection. With cursor holdability support added in JDBC 3.0, this default is simply replaced if an application specifies a different holdability later.

resourceProperties.name: dataTruncation
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether truncation of character data should cause warnings and exceptions to be generated (true) or if the data should just be silently truncated (false). The default is true, data truncation of character fields should be honored.

resourceProperties.name: dateFormat
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of how dates will be formatted. The possible values are : julian, mdy, dmy, ymd, usa, iso, eur, jis.

resourceProperties.name: dateSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the date separator will be. This is only valid in combination with some of the dateFormat values (per system rules). The possible values are: / - . , b

resourceProperties.name: decimalSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the decimal separator should be. The possible values are: '. ,'

resourceProperties.name: doEscapeProcessing
resourceProperties.description: This property sets a flag for whether or not statements under the connection must do escape processing. Using escape processing is a way to code your SQL statements so that they are generic and similar for all platforms, but then the database reads the escape clauses and substitutes the proper system specific version for the user. The default value for this property is true, as it must be to be compliant with the JDBC specification (escape processing is active by default - see the setEscapeProcessing method of the statement interface for more details).

resourceProperties.name: fullErrors
resourceProperties.description: Allows second-level error text the full system to be returned in SQLException object messages.

resourceProperties.name: libraries
resourceProperties.description: This property allows a list of libraries to be placed into the server job's library list or a specific default library to be set. The list of libraries can be seperated by spaces, colons or commas. The naming property affects how this property works. In the default case, where naming is set to 'sql', the library list has no effect on how the connection processes. There is a default library for all unqualified tables. By default, that library has the same name as the user profile that is connected. If the libraries property is specified, the first library in the list becomes the default library. If a default library is specified on the databaseName property (as in '*LOCAL/mylibrary'), that overrides any value in this property. In the case where naming is set to 'system', each of the libraries specified for this property is added to the user's library list and the library list is searched to resolve unqualified table references.

resourceProperties.name: lobThreshold
resourceProperties.description: Tells the driver to place the actual values into the ResultSet storage instead of locators for lob columns if the lob column is smaller than the threshold size.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future .

resourceProperties.name: prefetch
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether or not the driver should fetch the first data for a ResultSet immediately after execution or wait until the data is requested. Default is true.

resourceProperties.name: reuseObjects
resourceProperties.description: Specified whether or not the driver should attempt to reuse some types of objects after the user closes them. This is a performance enhancement. The default is true.

resourceProperties.name: serverTraceCategories
resourceProperties.description: This property enables tracing of the JDBC server job. If server tracing is enabled, tracing starts when the client connects to the server, and ends when the connection is disconnected. Trace data is collected in spooled files on the server. Multiple levels of server tracing can be turned on in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the set method. Note: This property is typically used by support personnel and its values are not discussed further.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This property is currently ignored and is planned for future use.

resourceProperties.name: timeFormat
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of how time values will be formatted. The possible values are: hms, usa, iso, eur, jis

resourceProperties.name: timeSeparator
resourceProperties.description: Allows modification of what the time separator will be. This is only valid in combination with some of the timeFormat values (per system rules). The possible values are: : . , b

resourceProperties.name: trace
resourceProperties.description: This property allows for turning on tracing of the connection. It can be used as a simple debugging aide. The default value is false, do not use tracing.

resourceProperties.name: translateBinary
resourceProperties.description: This property can be used to force the JDBC driver to treat binary and varbinary data values as if they where char and varchar data values. The default for this property is false, binary data is not treat the same as character data.

resourceProperties.name: useBlockInsert
resourceProperties.description: This property allows the Native JDBC driver to go into a block insert mode for inserting blocks of data into the database. This is an optimized version of the batch update. This optimized mode can only be used in applications that ensure that the do not break certain system constraints or data insert failures and potentially even data corruption can occur. The default is false.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: systemNaming
resourceProperties.description: Allows user to specify whether collections and tables should be separated by a period(SQL naming) or a slash(system naming). This property also determines whether a default library is used (SQL naming) or the library list is used (system naming). The default is SQL naming

resourceProperties.name: lockTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Any positive value is a valid lock timeout (in seconds) at the transaction level. A lock timeout of 0 means that there is no lock timeout value enforced at the transaction level, although there may be one enforced at other levels (the job or the table).

resourceProperties.name: transactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: 0 or any positive value. Any positive value is a valid transaction timeout (in seconds). A transaction timeout of 0 means that there is no transaction timeout value enforced. If the transaction is active for longer than the timeout value, it is marked rollback only, and subsequent attempts to perform work under it will cause an exception to occur.

resourceProperties.name: behaviorOverride
resourceProperties.description: Sets the Native JDBC Driver behaviors to override. Multiple behaviors can be changed in combination by adding the constants and passing that sum on the this method. Carefully consider the result of overriding the default behavior of the driver. For example, setting the value of this property to 1 means the driver will no longer thrown an exception if Statement.executeQuery() or PreparedStatement.executeQuery() do not return a result set. The driver will instead return null for the result set, even though the JDBC 3.0 specification states throwing an exception is the correct behavior. Be sure your application correctly handles the altered behavior.

resourceProperties.name: maximumScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. The value can range from 0 to the maximum precision. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: maximumPrecision
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum precision (length) that is returned for Numeric and Decimal data types. Valid values are 31 or 63. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: minimumDivideScale
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the minimum divide scale (number of decimal positions to the right of the decimal point) that is returned for both intermediary and result data types. The value can range from 0 to 9, not to exceed the maximum scale. If 0 is specified, minimum divide scale is not used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: translateHex
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type used by hex constants in SQL expressions. The possible values are 'binary, and 'character'. The binary setting indicates that hex contants will use the BINARY data type, which is new for V5R3. The character setting indicates that hex contants will use the CHARACTER FOR BIT DATA data type. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: cursorSensitivity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the type of cursors to be returned when sensitive cursors are requested. The default behavior is to return asensitive cursors. A setting of 'sensitive' will cause sensitive instead of asensitive cursors to be opened when ResultSet.TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE is used. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: directMap
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, the native JDBC driver will use the database server's ability to directly fetch rows of data into a buffer. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.

resourceProperties.name: queryOptimizeGoal
resourceProperties.description: This is an optional property. The default value is '2'. This property specifies the query optimization goal used by the database server. A value of 1 indicates that '*FIRSTIO' should be used. For '*FIRSTIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of returning the first page of output as fast as possible. A value of 2 indicates that '*ALLIO' should be used. For '*ALLIO', queries will be optimized with the goal of running the entire query to completion in the shortest amount of elapsed time. This property is valid for V5R4 and later.
