resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, select 1 from smi_build_status, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table smi_build_status is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Informix using the IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver

factories.name: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver - DataSource
factories.providerType: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver - DataSource
factories.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - One-phase commit data source for Informix using the IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This is an actual database name, and its not the locally catalogued database name. The Universal JDBC Driver does not rely on information catalogued in the DB2 database directory.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The driverType, Informix only supports type 4

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP address or host name for the DRDA server. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP port number where the DRDA server resides. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: currentLockTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether DB2 Database for Linux, UNIX, and Windows servers wait for a lock when the lock cannot be obtained immediately.

resourceProperties.name: DBANSIWARN
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ suppresses warnings about IDS extensions to ANSI

resourceProperties.name: DBDATE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the end-user format of DATE values.

resourceProperties.name: DBPATH
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a colon-separated list of values that identify the database servers that contain databases.

resourceProperties.name: DBSPACETEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of collections on the server. If this property is specified, the currentPackageSet property is ignored.

resourceProperties.name: DBTEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the full path name of an existing directory in which temporary files and temporary tables are placed.

resourceProperties.name: DBUPSPACE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum amount of system disk space and maximum amount of memory, in kilobytes, that the UPDATE STATISTICS statement can use when it constructs multiple column distributions simultaneously.

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether invocation of the Connection.prepareStatement method results in immediate preparation of an SQL statement on the data source, or whether statement preparation is deferred until the PreparedStatement.execute method is executed.

resourceProperties.name: DELIMIDENT
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether delimited SQL identifiers can be used in an application.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting can affect whether LOB data is fully materialized in the JDBC driver when a row is fetched, or whether LOB data is retrieved in pieces as needed. The actual behavior depends on whether the database server supports progressive streaming. Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property. The default value is true.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_DIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows query optimization directives from within a query.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_EXTDIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows external query optimization directives from the sysdirectives system catalog table to be applied to queries in existing applications.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_UPDDESC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether a DESCRIBE of an UPDATE statement is permitted.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_XASTDCOMPLIANCE_XAEND
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether global transactions are freed only after an explicit rollback, or after any rollback.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXOPCACHE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the size of the memory cache, in kilobytes, for the staging-area blobspace of the client application.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXSTACKSIZE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the stack size, in kilobytes, that the database server uses for the primary thread of a client session.

resourceProperties.name: keepDynamic
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the data source keeps already prepared dynamic SQL statements in the dynamic statement cache after commit points so that those prepared statements can be reused.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: NODEFDAC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the database server prevents default table privileges (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE) from being granted to PUBLIC when a new table is created during the current session, in a database that is not ANSI compliant.

resourceProperties.name: OPTCOMPIND
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the preferred method for performing a join operation on an ordered pair of tables.

resourceProperties.name: OPTOFC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to enable optimize-OPEN-FETCH-CLOSE functionality.

resourceProperties.name: PDQPRIORITY
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the degree of parallelism that the database server uses.

resourceProperties.name: progressiveStreaming
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses progressive streaming when progressive streaming is supported on the data source. Valid values are DB2BaseDataSource.YES (1) and DB2BaseDataSource.NO (2). The default value is DB2BaseDataSource.NOT_SET (0). Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property.

resourceProperties.name: PSORT_DBTEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the full path name of a directory in which the database server writes temporary files that are used for a sort operation.

resourceProperties.name: PSORT_NPROCS
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum number of threads that the database server can use to sort a query.

resourceProperties.name: queryDataSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a hint that is used to control the amount of query data, in bytes, that is returned from the data source on each fetch operation.

resourceProperties.name: resultSetHoldabilityForCatalogQueries
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether cursors for queries that are executed on behalf of DatabaseMetaData methods remain open after a commit operation. When an application executes DatabaseMetaData methods, the JDBC driver executes queries against the catalog of the target data source. By default, the holdability of those cursors is the same as the holdability of application cursors. To use different holdability for catalog queries, use the resultSetHoldabilityForCatalogQueries property. Possible values are HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT (1), CLOSE_CURSORS_AT_COMMIT (2), or the default value 0, which means to use the resultSetHoldability setting for catalog queries.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether JDBC SQLException.getMessage or SQLWarning.getMessage calls cause the JDBC driver to invoke a server-side stored procedure that retrieves the message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: securityMechanism
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the DRDA security mechanism.

resourceProperties.name: STMT_CACHE
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether the database server uses the SQL statement cache.

resourceProperties.name: traceDirectory
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a directory into which trace information is written.

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the name of a file into which the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ writes trace information.

resourceProperties.name: traceFileAppend
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to append to or overwrite the file that is specified by the traceFile property.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the level of trace, determined by a bitwise combination of constants: TRACE_NONE=0, TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS=1, TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS=2, TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS=4, TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION=16, TRACE_CONNECTS=32, TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS=64, TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA=128, TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA=256, TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS=512, TRACE_SQLJ=1024, TRACE_META_CALLS=8192, TRACE_DATASOURCE_CALLS=16384, TRACE_LARGE_OBJECT_CALLS=32768, TRACE_SYSTEM_MONITOR=131072, TRACE_TRACEPOINTS=262144, TRACE_ALL=-1.

resourceProperties.name: useJDBC4ColumnNameAndLabelSemantics
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ handles column labels in ResultSetMetaData.getColumnName, ResultSetMetaData.getColumnLabel, and ResultSet.findColumn method calls.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Informix using the IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver

factories.name: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver - XA DataSource
factories.providerType: Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Informix Using IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver - XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Two-phase commit enabled data source for Informix using the IBM DB2 JDBC Universal Driver

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This is an actual database name, and its not the locally catalogued database name. The Universal JDBC Driver does not rely on information catalogued in the DB2 database directory.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The driverType, Informix only supports type 4

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP address or host name for the DRDA server. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP port number where the DRDA server resides. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: currentLockTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether DB2 Database for Linux, UNIX, and Windows servers wait for a lock when the lock cannot be obtained immediately.

resourceProperties.name: DBANSIWARN
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ suppresses warnings about IDS extensions to ANSI

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Informix Using IBM JCC Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - One-phase commit Informix provider using the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ. IBM Data Server Driver is the next generation of the Universal JCC driver. This provider is configurable in version 7.0 and later nodes.

factories.name: Informix Using IBM JCC Driver - DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Informix Using IBM JCC Driver - DataSource
factories.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Informix data source using the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ. IBM Data Server Driver is the next generation of the Universal JCC driver. This data source type is only supported in version 7.0 and later nodes.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether invocation of the Connection.prepareStatement method results in immediate preparation of an SQL statement on the data source, or whether statement preparation is deferred until the PreparedStatement.execute method is executed.

resourceProperties.name: DELIMIDENT
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether delimited SQL identifiers can be used in an application.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: defaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the default transaction isolation level for new connections. The data type of this property is int. When defaultIsolationLevel is set on a DataSource, all connections that are created from that DataSource have the default isolation level that is specified by defaultIsolationLevel. The webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel property overrides this value.

resourceProperties.name: enableNamedParameterMarkers
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether support for named parameter markers is enabled in the JDBC driver. Possible values of enableNamedParameterMarkers are: 1 (YES), 2 (NO), or 0 (NOT_SET). The default is 0 and has the same behavior as the value 2.

resourceProperties.name: enableSeamlessFailover
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses seamless failover for client reroute. Possible values of enableSeamlessFailover are: 1 (YES), 2 (NO), or 0 (NOT_SET). The default is 0 and has the same behavior as the value 2. Seamless failover means that the driver does not throw an SQLException on a successful client reroute under certain conditions. For connections to DB2 for z/OS, if enableSysplexWLB is set to true, enableSeamlessFailover has no effect.

resourceProperties.name: enableSysplexWLB
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether the Sysplex workload balancing function of the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ is enabled. The default is false. This property applies only to IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ type 4 connectivity.

resourceProperties.name: fetchSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the default fetch size for ResultSet objects that are generated from Statement objects. The fetchSize property differs from the queryDataSize property. fetchSize affects the number of rows that are returned, and queryDataSize affects the number of bytes that are returned.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting can affect whether LOB data is fully materialized in the JDBC driver when a row is fetched, or whether LOB data is retrieved in pieces as needed. The actual behavior depends on whether the database server supports progressive streaming. Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property. The default value is true.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_DIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows query optimization directives from within a query.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_EXTDIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows external query optimization directives from the sysdirectives system catalog table to be applied to queries in existing applications.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_UPDDESC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether a DESCRIBE of an UPDATE statement is permitted.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_XASTDCOMPLIANCE_XAEND
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether global transactions are freed only after an explicit rollback, or after any rollback.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXOPCACHE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the size of the memory cache, in kilobytes, for the staging-area blobspace of the client application.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXSTACKSIZE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the stack size, in kilobytes, that the database server uses for the primary thread of a client session.

resourceProperties.name: keepDynamic
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the data source keeps already prepared dynamic SQL statements in the dynamic statement cache after commit points so that those prepared statements can be reused.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: NODEFDAC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the database server prevents default table privileges (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE) from being granted to PUBLIC when a new table is created during the current session, in a database that is not ANSI compliant.

resourceProperties.name: OPTCOMPIND
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the preferred method for performing a join operation on an ordered pair of tables.

resourceProperties.name: OPTOFC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to enable optimize-OPEN-FETCH-CLOSE functionality.

resourceProperties.name: PDQPRIORITY
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the degree of parallelism that the database server uses.

resourceProperties.name: progressiveStreaming
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses progressive streaming when progressive streaming is supported on the data source. Valid values are DB2BaseDataSource.YES (1) and DB2BaseDataSource.NO (2). The default value is DB2BaseDataSource.NOT_SET (0). Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property.

resourceProperties.name: PSORT_DBTEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the full path name of a directory in which the database server writes temporary files that are used for a sort operation.

resourceProperties.name: PSORT_NPROCS
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum number of threads that the database server can use to sort a query.

resourceProperties.name: queryDataSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a hint that is used to control the amount of query data, in bytes, that is returned from the data source on each fetch operation.

resourceProperties.name: resultSetHoldabilityForCatalogQueries
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether cursors for queries that are executed on behalf of DatabaseMetaData methods remain open after a commit operation. When an application executes DatabaseMetaData methods, the JDBC driver executes queries against the catalog of the target data source. By default, the holdability of those cursors is the same as the holdability of application cursors. To use different holdability for catalog queries, use the resultSetHoldabilityForCatalogQueries property. Possible values are HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT (1), CLOSE_CURSORS_AT_COMMIT (2), or the default value 0, which means to use the resultSetHoldability setting for catalog queries.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether JDBC SQLException.getMessage or SQLWarning.getMessage calls cause the JDBC driver to invoke a server-side stored procedure that retrieves the message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: securityMechanism
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the DRDA security mechanism.

resourceProperties.name: STMT_CACHE
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether the database server uses the SQL statement cache.

resourceProperties.name: traceDirectory
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a directory into which trace information is written.

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the name of a file into which the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ writes trace information.

resourceProperties.name: traceFileAppend
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to append to or overwrite the file that is specified by the traceFile property.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the level of trace, determined by a bitwise combination of constants: TRACE_NONE=0, TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS=1, TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS=2, TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS=4, TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION=16, TRACE_CONNECTS=32, TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS=64, TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA=128, TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA=256, TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS=512, TRACE_SQLJ=1024, TRACE_META_CALLS=8192, TRACE_DATASOURCE_CALLS=16384, TRACE_LARGE_OBJECT_CALLS=32768, TRACE_SYSTEM_MONITOR=131072, TRACE_TRACEPOINTS=262144, TRACE_ALL=-1.

resourceProperties.name: useJDBC4ColumnNameAndLabelSemantics
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ handles column labels in ResultSetMetaData.getColumnName, ResultSetMetaData.getColumnLabel, and ResultSet.findColumn method calls.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Informix Using IBM JCC Driver (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Two-phase commit Informix provider using the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ. IBM Data Server Driver is the next generation of the Universal JCC driver. This provider is only supported in version 7.0 and later nodes.

factories.name: Informix Using IBM JCC Driver - XA DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Informix Using IBM JCC Driver - XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer 7.0 - maxVer null - Informix XA-capable data source using the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ. IBM Data Server Driver is the next generation of the Universal JCC driver. This data source type is configurable in version 7.0 and later nodes.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This is an actual database name, and its not the locally catalogued database name. The Universal JDBC Driver does not rely on information catalogued in the DB2 database directory.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The driverType, Informix only supports type 4

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP address or host name for the DRDA server. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP port number where the DRDA server resides. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: currentLockTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether DB2 Database for Linux, UNIX, and Windows servers wait for a lock when the lock cannot be obtained immediately.

resourceProperties.name: DBANSIWARN
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ suppresses warnings about IDS extensions to ANSI

resourceProperties.name: DBDATE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the end-user format of DATE values.

resourceProperties.name: DBPATH
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a colon-separated list of values that identify the database servers that contain databases.

resourceProperties.name: DBSPACETEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of collections on the server. If this property is specified, the currentPackageSet property is ignored.

resourceProperties.name: DBTEMP
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the full path name of an existing directory in which temporary files and temporary tables are placed.

resourceProperties.name: DBUPSPACE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum amount of system disk space and maximum amount of memory, in kilobytes, that the UPDATE STATISTICS statement can use when it constructs multiple column distributions simultaneously.

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether invocation of the Connection.prepareStatement method results in immediate preparation of an SQL statement on the data source, or whether statement preparation is deferred until the PreparedStatement.execute method is executed.

resourceProperties.name: DELIMIDENT
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether delimited SQL identifiers can be used in an application.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: defaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the default transaction isolation level for new connections. The data type of this property is int. When defaultIsolationLevel is set on a DataSource, all connections that are created from that DataSource have the default isolation level that is specified by defaultIsolationLevel. The webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel property overrides this value.

resourceProperties.name: enableNamedParameterMarkers
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether support for named parameter markers is enabled in the JDBC driver. Possible values of enableNamedParameterMarkers are: 1 (YES), 2 (NO), or 0 (NOT_SET). The default is 0 and has the same behavior as the value 2.

resourceProperties.name: enableSeamlessFailover
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses seamless failover for client reroute. Possible values of enableSeamlessFailover are: 1 (YES), 2 (NO), or 0 (NOT_SET). The default is 0 and has the same behavior as the value 2. Seamless failover means that the driver does not throw an SQLException on a successful client reroute under certain conditions. For connections to DB2 for z/OS, if enableSysplexWLB is set to true, enableSeamlessFailover has no effect.

resourceProperties.name: enableSysplexWLB
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether the Sysplex workload balancing function of the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ is enabled. The default is false. This property applies only to IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ type 4 connectivity.

resourceProperties.name: fetchSize
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the default fetch size for ResultSet objects that are generated from Statement objects. The fetchSize property differs from the queryDataSize property. fetchSize affects the number of rows that are returned, and queryDataSize affects the number of bytes that are returned.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting can affect whether LOB data is fully materialized in the JDBC driver when a row is fetched, or whether LOB data is retrieved in pieces as needed. The actual behavior depends on whether the database server supports progressive streaming. Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property. The default value is true.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_DIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows query optimization directives from within a query.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_EXTDIRECTIVES
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the optimizer allows external query optimization directives from the sysdirectives system catalog table to be applied to queries in existing applications.

resourceProperties.name: IFX_UPDDESC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether a DESCRIBE of an UPDATE statement is permitted.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether global transactions are freed only after an explicit rollback, or after any rollback.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXOPCACHE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the size of the memory cache, in kilobytes, for the staging-area blobspace of the client application.

resourceProperties.name: INFORMIXSTACKSIZE
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the stack size, in kilobytes, that the database server uses for the primary thread of a client session.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the database server prevents default table privileges (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE) from being granted to PUBLIC when a new table is created during the current session, in a database that is not ANSI compliant.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies the preferred method for performing a join operation on an ordered pair of tables.

resourceProperties.name: OPTOFC
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to enable optimize-OPEN-FETCH-CLOSE functionality.

resourceProperties.name: PDQPRIORITY
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the degree of parallelism that the database server uses.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses progressive streaming when progressive streaming is supported on the data source. Valid values are DB2BaseDataSource.YES (1) and DB2BaseDataSource.NO (2). The default value is DB2BaseDataSource.NOT_SET (0). Please refer to DB2 documentation for this property.

resourceProperties.name: PSORT_NPROCS
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the maximum number of threads that the database server can use to sort a query.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies a directory into which trace information is written.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies the name of a file into which the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ writes trace information.

resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to append to or overwrite the file that is specified by the traceFile property.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where Sybase resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the protocol to be used. When set to socket, SSL encryption is not used. The possible values are: socket, SSL. Default is socket.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: version
resourceProperties.description: The version of the driver.

resourceProperties.name: resourceManagerName
resourceProperties.description: The resource manager name.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionProperties
resourceProperties.description: The properties that are needed for connection. Please refer to Sybase documentation for the appropriate properties.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Sybase JDBC 4 Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 8.0 - maxVer null - Sybase JDBC 4 Driver. This provider is only configurable in version 8.0 and later nodes

factories.name: Sybase JDBC 4 Driver DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Sybase JDBC 4 Driver DataSource
factories.description: minVer 8.0 - maxVer null - New JDBC 4 Datasource. This Datasource type is only configurable in version 8.0 and later nodes

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where Sybase resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the protocol to be used. When set to socket, SSL encryption is not used. The possible values are: socket, SSL. Default is socket.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: version
resourceProperties.description: The version of the driver.

resourceProperties.name: resourceManagerName
resourceProperties.description: The resource manager name.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionProperties
resourceProperties.description: The properties that are needed for connection. Please refer to Sybase documentation for the appropriate properties.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: enableClientInformation
resourceProperties.description: Enables the implicit passing of client information on database connections. The client information provided on each connection is the same as for the WAS.clientinfo trace group. Whereas the WAS.clientinfo trace is configured on an application server, the enableClientInformation property applies to a data source configuration.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 8.0 - maxVer null - Sybase JDBC 4 Driver for two-phase commit (JTA/XA). This provider is only configurable in version 8.0 and later nodes
