factories.description: Legacy data source for the DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. The range of supported values is: direct, cursor. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the data source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver trace attributes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time for attempting a connection to the database. If this value is non-zero, the connection attempt will time out once the specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this data source.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true (by default), one phase connections are used. When false, two phase connections are used. This value must remain consistent with the provider. Please do not change it.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by stringInputParameterType and stringOutputParameterType. Specifies whether the JDBC driver sends string parameters to the database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: The code page that the JDBC driver uses for converting character data. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Controls the amount of memory the JDBC driver uses when caching insensitive result set data. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers property includes the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections. This property has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: authenticationMethod
resourceProperties.description: The type of authentication used by the JDBC driver to connect to Microsoft SQL Server. Possible values are 'userIdPassword', 'ntlm', and 'ntlmjava'. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Configures when database trigger results are reported by the JDBC driver. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Number of attempts made by the JDBC driver to retry connections to the list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Number of seconds to wait before JDBC driver retries the list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Configures whether or not the JDBC driver provides load balancing of connection requests to the list of primary and alternate database servers. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: receiveStringParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver describes String output parameters for stored procedures to the database. The range of values is: NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, DESCRIBE. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. The range of values is: 0, 1. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableCancelTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the statement timeout also applies to the cancel request sent in response to the query timeout. If enabled, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: javaDoubleToString
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses the JVM conversion algorithm or its own algorithm when converting double and float values to string values. When setting the property to false (JDBC driver algorithm) rounding differences within the allowable error of the double and float data types might occur. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: packetSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the size of network packets sent from Microsoft SQL Server to the application server machine. The range is -1, 0 or an integer from 1 to 128. -1 indicates the default packet size used by the database server. 0 indicates a packet size of 8 KB. When a value is specified in the range of 1 to 128, the packet size is that value multiplied by 512 bytes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver should use server-side updatable cursors or client-side updatable cursors when an updatable result set is requested. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable
resourceProperties.description: The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.

resourceProperties.name: describeParameters
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by describeInputParameters and describeOutputParameters. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe'. When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: accountingInfo
resourceProperties.description: Accounting information stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: The application name to be stored under program_name in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadBatchSize
resourceProperties.description: A hint for DataDirect Bulk Load feature to load the specified the number of rows in a single trip. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadOptions
resourceProperties.description: Additional options for the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: clientHostName
resourceProperties.description: The host name to be stored in under hostname in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: clientUser
resourceProperties.description: Client user name stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: convertNull
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver handles data conversions for null values. When configured to 1, the JDBC driver performs a type check of the requested data type against the data type of the table column storing the data. When configured to 0, the JDBC driver does not perform the data type check if the value of the column is null. This allows null values to be returned even when the conversion is undefined. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe input parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe output parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeInputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for input parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeOutputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for output parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: domain
resourceProperties.description: Domain server name that is used for NTLM authentication. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableBulkLoad
resourceProperties.description: Enables the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: encryptionMethod
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how to encrypt data and login requests between the JDBC driver and Microsoft SQL Server. The range of values is: noEncryption, SSL, requestSSL, loginSSL. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverGranularity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the granularity type for failover. Values are: nonAtomic, atomic, atomicWithRepositioning. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverMode
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the conditions under which failover occurs. Values are: connect | extended | select. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverPreconnect
resourceProperties.description: Configures the JDBC driver to simultaneously attempt connections to both the primary server and alternate server.

resourceProperties.name: fetchTSWTZAsTimestamp
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether datetimeoffset columns are returned as JDBC TIMESTAMP or JDBC VARCHAR. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: hostNameInCertificate
resourceProperties.description: The host name for certificate validation when both SSL encryption and ValidateServerCertificate are enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: initializationString
resourceProperties.description: List of SQL commands for one-time initialization of connections. The commands are not reissued when the connection is pooled and reused. Multiple commands must be separated by semicolons.

resourceProperties.name: longDataCacheSize
resourceProperties.description: Upper bound (in Kilobytes) on memory used by the JDBC driver to buffer long data. The range is: -1, 0, or a positive integer. -1 disables long data caching, making the driver incapable of refetching or fetching out of order. 0 indicates that all available memory should be used before paging. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: queryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Defines a default query timeout for java.sql.Statement.getQueryTimeout. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String input parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String output parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: suppressConnectionWarnings
resourceProperties.description: Controls if the JDBC driver issues warnings for changed database and language when it connects to the database.

resourceProperties.name: transactionMode
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver delimits the start of a local transaction. The range of values is: implicit, explicit. Implicit transaction mode means that Microsoft SQL Server, not the JDBC driver, automatically starts a transaction when a transactionable statement is executed. Explicit transaction mode means that the JDBC driver, not Microsoft SQL Server, starts a new transaction. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: truncateFractionalSeconds
resourceProperties.description: Truncates fractional digits for timestamps beyond millseconds. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: trustStore
resourceProperties.description: Location of the truststore file to use when using SSL server authentication. This setting is applicable only when ValidateServerCertificate is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: validateServerCertificate
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the JDBC driver should validate the certificate sent by the database server. This setting is applicable only when SSL encryption is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: XMLDescribeType
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type to which the JDBC driver maps XML data. The range of supported values is: longvarchar, longvarbinary. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

factories.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
factories.description: Data source for the DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP port number where Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. The range of supported values is: direct, cursor. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the data source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver trace attributes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time for attempting a connection to the database. If this value is non-zero, the connection attempt will time out once the specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this data source.

resourceProperties.name: enable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. This value must remain consistent with the provider. Please do not change it.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by stringInputParameterType and stringOutputParameterType. Specifies whether the JDBC driver sends string parameters to the database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: The code page that the JDBC driver uses for converting character data. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Controls the amount of memory the JDBC driver uses when caching insensitive result set data. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers property includes the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections. This property has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: authenticationMethod
resourceProperties.description: The type of authentication used by the JDBC driver to connect to Microsoft SQL Server. Possible values are 'userIdPassword', 'ntlm', 'ntlmjava', 'kerberos', or 'auto'. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Configures when database trigger results are reported by the JDBC driver. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Number of attempts made by the JDBC driver to retry connections to the list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Number of seconds to wait before JDBC driver retries the list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Configures whether or not the JDBC driver provides load balancing of connection requests to the list of primary and alternate database servers. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: receiveStringParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver describes String output parameters for stored procedures to the database. The range of values is: NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, DESCRIBE. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. The range of values is: 0, 1. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableCancelTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the statement timeout also applies to the cancel request sent in response to the query timeout. If enabled, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: javaDoubleToString
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses the JVM conversion algorithm or its own algorithm when converting double and float values to string values. When setting the property to false (JDBC driver algorithm) rounding differences within the allowable error of the double and float data types might occur. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: packetSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the size of network packets sent from Microsoft SQL Server to the application server machine. The range is -1, 0 or an integer from 1 to 128. -1 indicates the default packet size used by the database server. 0 indicates a packet size of 8 KB. When a value is specified in the range of 1 to 128, the packet size is that value multiplied by 512 bytes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver should use server-side updatable cursors or client-side updatable cursors when an updatable result set is requested. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable
resourceProperties.description: The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.

resourceProperties.name: describeParameters
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by describeInputParameters and describeOutputParameters. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe'. When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: accountingInfo
resourceProperties.description: Accounting information stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: The application name to be stored under program_name in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadBatchSize
resourceProperties.description: A hint for DataDirect Bulk Load feature to load the specified the number of rows in a single trip. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadOptions
resourceProperties.description: Additional options for the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: clientHostName
resourceProperties.description: The host name to be stored in under hostname in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: clientUser
resourceProperties.description: Client user name stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: convertNull
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver handles data conversions for null values. When configured to 1, the JDBC driver performs a type check of the requested data type against the data type of the table column storing the data. When configured to 0, the JDBC driver does not perform the data type check if the value of the column is null. This allows null values to be returned even when the conversion is undefined. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe input parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe output parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeInputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for input parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeOutputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for output parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: domain
resourceProperties.description: Domain server name that is used for NTLM authentication. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableBulkLoad
resourceProperties.description: Enables the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: encryptionMethod
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how to encrypt data and login requests between the JDBC driver and Microsoft SQL Server. The range of values is: noEncryption, SSL, requestSSL, loginSSL. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverGranularity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the granularity type for failover. Values are: nonAtomic, atomic, atomicWithRepositioning. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverMode
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the conditions under which failover occurs. Values are: connect | extended | select. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverPreconnect
resourceProperties.description: Configures the JDBC driver to simultaneously attempt connections to both the primary server and alternate server.

resourceProperties.name: fetchTSWTZAsTimestamp
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether datetimeoffset columns are returned as JDBC TIMESTAMP or JDBC VARCHAR. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: hostNameInCertificate
resourceProperties.description: The host name for certificate validation when both SSL encryption and ValidateServerCertificate are enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: initializationString
resourceProperties.description: List of SQL commands for one-time initialization of connections. The commands are not reissued when the connection is pooled and reused. Multiple commands must be separated by semicolons.

resourceProperties.name: JDBCBehavior
resourceProperties.description: Chooses between JDBC 4.0 (value of 0) or JDBC 3.0 (value of 1) behavior. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: longDataCacheSize
resourceProperties.description: Upper bound (in Kilobytes) on memory used by the JDBC driver to buffer long data. The range is: -1, 0, or a positive integer. -1 disables long data caching, making the driver incapable of refetching or fetching out of order. 0 indicates that all available memory should be used before paging. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: queryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Defines a default query timeout for java.sql.Statement.getQueryTimeout. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String input parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String output parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: suppressConnectionWarnings
resourceProperties.description: Controls if the JDBC driver issues warnings for changed database and language when it connects to the database.

resourceProperties.name: transactionMode
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver delimits the start of a local transaction. The range of values is: implicit, explicit. Implicit transaction mode means that Microsoft SQL Server, not the JDBC driver, automatically starts a transaction when a transactionable statement is executed. Explicit transaction mode means that the JDBC driver, not Microsoft SQL Server, starts a new transaction. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: truncateFractionalSeconds
resourceProperties.description: Truncates fractional digits for timestamps beyond millseconds. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: trustStore
resourceProperties.description: Location of the truststore file to use when using SSL server authentication. This setting is applicable only when ValidateServerCertificate is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: validateServerCertificate
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the JDBC driver should validate the certificate sent by the database server. This setting is applicable only when SSL encryption is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: XMLDescribeType
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type to which the JDBC driver maps XML data. The range of supported values is: longvarchar, longvarbinary. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server (XA).

factories.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.description: Legacy XA data source for the DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the Microsoft SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. The range of supported values is: direct, cursor. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the data source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver trace attributes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time for attempting a connection to the database. If this value is non-zero, the connection attempt will time out once the specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this data source.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false (by default), two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used. This value must remain consistent with the provider. Please do not change it.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by stringInputParameterType and stringOutputParameterType. Specifies whether the JDBC driver sends string parameters to the database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: The code page that the JDBC driver uses for converting character data. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Controls the amount of memory the JDBC driver uses when caching insensitive result set data. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers property includes the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections. This property has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: authenticationMethod
resourceProperties.description: The type of authentication used by the JDBC driver to connect to Microsoft SQL Server. Possible values are 'userIdPassword', 'ntlm', and 'ntlmjava'. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Configures when database trigger results are reported by the JDBC driver. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Number of attempts made by the JDBC driver to retry connections to the list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Number of seconds to wait before JDBC driver retries the list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Configures whether or not the JDBC driver provides load balancing of connection requests to the list of primary and alternate database servers. See the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: receiveStringParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver describes String output parameters for stored procedures to the database. The range of values is: NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, DESCRIBE. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether or not the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. The range of values is: 0, 1. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableCancelTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the statement timeout also applies to the cancel request sent in response to the query timeout. If enabled, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: javaDoubleToString
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver uses the JVM conversion algorithm or its own algorithm when converting double and float values to string values. When setting the property to false (JDBC driver algorithm) rounding differences within the allowable error of the double and float data types might occur. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: packetSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the size of network packets sent from Microsoft SQL Server to the application server machine. The range is -1, 0 or an integer from 1 to 128. -1 indicates the default packet size used by the database server. 0 indicates a packet size of 8 KB. When a value is specified in the range of 1 to 128, the packet size is that value multiplied by 512 bytes. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the JDBC driver should use server-side updatable cursors or client-side updatable cursors when an updatable result set is requested. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: XATransactionGroup
resourceProperties.description: . The transaction group ID that identifies any distributed transactions initiated by the connection. This ID can be used for distributed transaction cleanup purposes. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more details.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable
resourceProperties.description: The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.

resourceProperties.name: describeParameters
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated in version 4.2 of DataDirect Connect for JDBC. Replaced by describeInputParameters and describeOutputParameters. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe'. When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: accountingInfo
resourceProperties.description: Accounting information stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: The application name to be stored under program_name in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadBatchSize
resourceProperties.description: A hint for DataDirect Bulk Load feature to load the specified the number of rows in a single trip. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: bulkLoadOptions
resourceProperties.description: Additional options for the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: clientHostName
resourceProperties.description: The host name to be stored in under hostname in the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: clientUser
resourceProperties.description: Client user name stored by the JDBC driver. It is not stored in the database.

resourceProperties.name: convertNull
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver handles data conversions for null values. When configured to 1, the JDBC driver performs a type check of the requested data type against the data type of the table column storing the data. When configured to 0, the JDBC driver does not perform the data type check if the value of the column is null. This allows null values to be returned even when the conversion is undefined. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe input parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dateTimeOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe output parameters that are Date, Time, and Timestamp. Applies to Microsoft SQL Server 2008 and above. Possible values are: auto, dateTime, dateTimeOffset. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeInputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for input parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: describeOutputParameters
resourceProperties.description: Controls how the JDBC driver chooses the data type for output parameters. Possible values are: noDescribe, describeIfString, describeIfDateTime, describeAll. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: domain
resourceProperties.description: Domain server name that is used for NTLM authentication. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableBulkLoad
resourceProperties.description: Enables the DataDirect Bulk Load feature. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: encryptionMethod
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how to encrypt data and login requests between the JDBC driver and Microsoft SQL Server. The range of values is: noEncryption, SSL, requestSSL, loginSSL. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverGranularity
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the granularity type for failover. Values are: nonAtomic, atomic, atomicWithRepositioning. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverMode
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the conditions under which failover occurs. Values are: connect | extended | select. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: failoverPreconnect
resourceProperties.description: Configures the JDBC driver to simultaneously attempt connections to both the primary server and alternate server.

resourceProperties.name: fetchTSWTZAsTimestamp
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether datetimeoffset columns are returned as JDBC TIMESTAMP or JDBC VARCHAR. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: hostNameInCertificate
resourceProperties.description: The host name for certificate validation when both SSL encryption and ValidateServerCertificate are enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: initializationString
resourceProperties.description: List of SQL commands for one-time initialization of connections. The commands are not reissued when the connection is pooled and reused. Multiple commands must be separated by semicolons.

resourceProperties.name: longDataCacheSize
resourceProperties.description: Upper bound (in Kilobytes) on memory used by the JDBC driver to buffer long data. The range is: -1, 0, or a positive integer. -1 disables long data caching, making the driver incapable of refetching or fetching out of order. 0 indicates that all available memory should be used before paging. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: queryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Defines a default query timeout for java.sql.Statement.getQueryTimeout. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringInputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String input parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: stringOutputParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Determines the data type used by the JDBC driver to describe String output parameters. Possible values are: nvarchar (Unicode), varchar (default character encoding). Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: suppressConnectionWarnings
resourceProperties.description: Controls if the JDBC driver issues warnings for changed database and language when it connects to the database.

resourceProperties.name: transactionMode
resourceProperties.description: Determines how the JDBC driver delimits the start of a local transaction. The range of values is: implicit, explicit. Implicit transaction mode means that Microsoft SQL Server, not the JDBC driver, automatically starts a transaction when a transactionable statement is executed. Explicit transaction mode means that the JDBC driver, not Microsoft SQL Server, starts a new transaction. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: truncateFractionalSeconds
resourceProperties.description: Truncates fractional digits for timestamps beyond millseconds. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: trustStore
resourceProperties.description: Location of the truststore file to use when using SSL server authentication. This setting is applicable only when ValidateServerCertificate is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: validateServerCertificate
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the JDBC driver should validate the certificate sent by the database server. This setting is applicable only when SSL encryption is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: XMLDescribeType
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type to which the JDBC driver maps XML data. The range of supported values is: longvarchar, longvarbinary. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

factories.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.description: XA data source for the DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver

resourceProperties.description: Chooses between JDBC 4.0 (value of 0) or JDBC 3.0 (value of 1) behavior. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

Implicit transaction mode means that Microsoft SQL Server, not the JDBC driver, automatically starts a transaction when a transactionable statement is executed. Explicit transaction mode means that the JDBC driver, not Microsoft SQL Server, starts a new transaction. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: truncateFractionalSeconds

resourceProperties.name: trustStore
resourceProperties.description: Location of the truststore file to use when using SSL server authentication. This setting is applicable only when ValidateServerCertificate is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: validateServerCertificate
resourceProperties.description: Specifies if the JDBC driver should validate the certificate sent by the database server. This setting is applicable only when SSL encryption is enabled. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: XMLDescribeType
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the data type to which the JDBC driver maps XML data. The range of supported values is: longvarchar, longvarbinary. Please refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - maxVer 6.1 - The WebSphere Connect JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

factories.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource
factories.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server
factories.jndiName: jdbc/WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - maxVer 6.1 - The WebSphere Connect JDBC data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Values are 'cursor' or 'direct'. The default is 'direct'. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver level trace attributes. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false (by default), two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the codepage the driver uses when converting character data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the amount of memory used by the driver to cache insensitive result set data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: authenticationMethod
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Windows Authentication to Microsoft SQL Server is not supported by WebSphere Application Server.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines how to report results generated by database triggers (stored procedures which run when a table is modified). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of seconds to wait before retrying a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether to use client load balancing in attempts to connect to a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: receiveStringParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Specifies how the JDBC driver describes String stored procedure output parameters to the database. Valid values are NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, and DESCRIBE. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Controls whether the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. Valid values are 1 and 0. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableCancelTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether a cancel request sent as the result of a query timing out is subject to the same query timeout value as the statement it cancels. If set to true, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. For example, if your application sets Statement.setQueryTimeout(5) on a statement and that statement is cancelled because its timeout value was exceeded, a cancel request is sent that also will time out if its execution exceeds 5 seconds. If the cancel request times out, the driver throws an exception indicating that the cancel request was timed out and the connection is no longer valid. If set to false (the default), the cancel request does not time out.

resourceProperties.name: javaDoubleToString
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses its internal conversion algorithm or the JVM conversion algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to true, the driver uses the JVM algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to false (the default), the driver uses its internal algorithm when converting double or float values to string. Setting the property to false improves performance; however, slight rounding differences can occur when compared to the same conversion using the JVM algorithm. These differences are within the allowable error of the double and float data types.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the network interface card of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: packetSize
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. PacketSize={-1 | 0 | x}. Determines the number of bytes for each network packet transferred from the database server to the client machine. Adjusting the packet size can improve performance. The optimal value depends on the typical size of data inserted, updated, or retrieved by the application and the environment in which it is running. Typically, larger packet sizes work better for large amounts of data. For example, if an application regularly retrieves character values that are 10,000 characters in length, using a value of 32 (16 KB) typically results in improved performance. If set to -1, the driver uses the default packet size used by the database server. If set to 0 (the default), the driver uses a packet size of 8 KB. If set to x, an integer from 1 to 128, the driver uses a packet size that is a multiple of 512 bytes. For example, PacketSize=8 means to set the packet size to 8 * 512 bytes (4096 bytes).

resourceProperties.name: programName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the program_name column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses server-side cursors when an updatable result set is requested. If set to true, server-side updatable cursors are created when an updatable result set is requested. If set to false (the default), the default updatable result set functionality is used.

resourceProperties.name: WSID
resourceProperties.description: The workstation ID, which typically is the network name of the computer on which the application resides. If specified, this value is stored in the hostname column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be returned by sp_who and the Transact-SQL HOST_NAME function. The value can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.

resourceProperties.name: describeParameters
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe' (the default). When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. CHAR and VARCHAR columns are sent as BIGVARCHAR and translated to the appropriate character set. TEXT columns are sent as TEXT and are also translated to the appropriate character set. NCHAR and NVARCHAR columns are sent as NVARCHAR, while NTEXT is sent as NTEXT. If the driver is not able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver defaults to it's prior behavior. That is, it sends the data as BIGVARCHAR/TEXT or NVARCHAR/NTEXT based on the setting of SendStringParametersAsUnicode. Previously, the JDBC driver always sent ascii input streams as BIGVARCHAR and character stream readers as NVARCHAR. When describeParameters is set to 'noDescribe', the JDBC driver continues this behavior. However, when set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver sends the data as the column type defined on the server and translates as needed.

factories.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
factories.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server
factories.jndiName: jdbc/WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - maxVer 6.1 - The WebSphere Connect JDBC data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
