resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover

resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Windows Authentication to Microsoft SQL Server is not supported by WebSphere Application Server.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines how to report results generated by database triggers (stored procedures which run when a table is modified). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of seconds to wait before retrying a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether to use client load balancing in attempts to connect to a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: receiveStringParameterType
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Specifies how the JDBC driver describes String stored procedure output parameters to the database. Valid values are NVARCHAR, VARCHAR, and DESCRIBE. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Controls whether the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. Valid values are 1 and 0. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableCancelTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines whether a cancel request sent as the result of a query timing out is subject to the same query timeout value as the statement it cancels. If set to true, the cancel request times out using the same timeout value, in seconds, that is set for the statement it cancels. For example, if your application sets Statement.setQueryTimeout(5) on a statement and that statement is cancelled because its timeout value was exceeded, a cancel request is sent that also will time out if its execution exceeds 5 seconds. If the cancel request times out, the driver throws an exception indicating that the cancel request was timed out and the connection is no longer valid. If set to false (the default), the cancel request does not time out.

resourceProperties.name: javaDoubleToString
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses its internal conversion algorithm or the JVM conversion algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to true, the driver uses the JVM algorithm when converting double or float values to string values. If set to false (the default), the driver uses its internal algorithm when converting double or float values to string. Setting the property to false improves performance; however, slight rounding differences can occur when compared to the same conversion using the JVM algorithm. These differences are within the allowable error of the double and float data types.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the network interface card of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the net_address column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: packetSize
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. PacketSize={-1 | 0 | x}. Determines the number of bytes for each network packet transferred from the database server to the client machine. Adjusting the packet size can improve performance. The optimal value depends on the typical size of data inserted, updated, or retrieved by the application and the environment in which it is running. Typically, larger packet sizes work better for large amounts of data. For example, if an application regularly retrieves character values that are 10,000 characters in length, using a value of 32 (16 KB) typically results in improved performance. If set to -1, the driver uses the default packet size used by the database server. If set to 0 (the default), the driver uses a packet size of 8 KB. If set to x, an integer from 1 to 128, the driver uses a packet size that is a multiple of 512 bytes. For example, PacketSize=8 means to set the packet size to 8 * 512 bytes (4096 bytes).

resourceProperties.name: programName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the application connecting to Microsoft SQL Server. The value of this property appears in the program_name column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: useServerSideUpdatableCursors
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Determines whether the driver uses server-side cursors when an updatable result set is requested. If set to true, server-side updatable cursors are created when an updatable result set is requested. If set to false (the default), the default updatable result set functionality is used.

resourceProperties.name: WSID
resourceProperties.description: The workstation ID, which typically is the network name of the computer on which the application resides. If specified, this value is stored in the hostname column of the master.dbo.sysprocesses table and can be returned by sp_who and the Transact-SQL HOST_NAME function. The value can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: XATransactionGroup
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. The transaction group ID that identifies any distributed transactions initiated by the connection. This ID can be used for distributed transaction cleanup purposes. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more details.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The SnapshotSerializable custom data source property alters the meaning of the java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE constant to represent the Snapshot isolation level, provided ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION is configured on the database.

resourceProperties.name: describeParameters
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Possible values are 'describeIfString' and 'noDescribe' (the default). When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. CHAR and VARCHAR columns are sent as BIGVARCHAR and translated to the appropriate character set. TEXT columns are sent as TEXT and are also translated to the appropriate character set. NCHAR and NVARCHAR columns are sent as NVARCHAR, while NTEXT is sent as NTEXT. If the driver is not able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver defaults to it's prior behavior. That is, it sends the data as BIGVARCHAR/TEXT or NVARCHAR/NTEXT based on the setting of SendStringParametersAsUnicode. Previously, the JDBC driver always sent ascii input streams as BIGVARCHAR and character stream readers as NVARCHAR. When describeParameters is set to 'noDescribe', the JDBC driver continues this behavior. However, when set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver sends the data as the column type defined on the server and translates as needed.

factories.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.providerType: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - maxVer 6.1 - The WebSphere Connect JDBC data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP address of the MS SQL Server machine in dotted format or host name format.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The TCP/IP port number where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Values are 'cursor' or 'direct'. The default is 'direct'. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver level trace attributes. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for a full list of options.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: enable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the codepage the driver uses when converting character data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the amount of memory used by the driver to cache insensitive result set data. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: authenticationMethod
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Windows Authentication to Microsoft SQL Server is not supported by WebSphere Application Server.

resourceProperties.name: alwaysReportTriggerResults
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. Determines how to report results generated by database triggers (stored procedures which run when a table is modified). See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.0 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing

The value can be useful for database administration purposes.

resourceProperties.name: snapshotSerializable

When describeParameters is set to 'describeIfString', the JDBC driver attempts to describe all parameters in a single statement. The driver does not describe parameters for batch statements. If the driver is able to determine the datatype/collation information for the parameters, the driver sends the column's data in a format compatible with the column's data type. resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The SequeLink JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

factories.name: Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The SequeLink data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP address of the SequeLink server in dotted format or host name format.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port on which the SequeLink service is listening.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver level trace attributes. See the SequeLink documentation for a list of attributes.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: cipherSuites
resourceProperties.description: The Secure Socket Layer(SSL) cipher suites with which the SequeLink Java Client can use to connect. This property is required when networkProtocol=ssl.

resourceProperties.name: blockFetchForUpdate
resourceProperties.description: When the isolation level is ReadCommitted and a SELECT FOR UPDATE statement is issued against some data stores, the SequeLink Java Client does not lock the expected row. Default is 1 which does not lock the expected row.

resourceProperties.name: SLKStaticCursorLongColBuffLen
resourceProperties.description: The amount of data (in KB) that is buffered for SQL_LONGVARCHAR and SQL_LONGVARBINARY columns which an insensitive result set. Default is 4.

resourceProperties.name: certificateChecker
resourceProperties.description: The fully qualified class name of a user-defined server certificate checker class.

resourceProperties.name: serverDataSource
resourceProperties.description: A property that specifies a string to identify the server Data Source to be used for the connection. If unspecified, the configuration of the default server Data Source will be used for the connection.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false , two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the application that is establishing the Connections. When the application does not provide a value, the default value is SequeLink JDBC Application.

resourceProperties.name: MSSMapLongToDecimal
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: ORANumber0IsNumeric
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: allowPrefetch
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Enables the prefetch feature. When enabled, the JDBC driver requests a next set of rows from the server while the client is processing the previous set of rows. 0 = disable; 1 = enable.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. The memory caching scheme for scroll-insensitive cursors. When set to 0, the driver uses a memory caching mechanism that does not use disk overflow. When set to a value greater than 0, data overflows to disk when the size of cached data exceeds the specified amount, specified in kilobytes. When set to a value less than 0, the data provider providers better performance. However, memory use may be affected.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers which can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The number of seconds to wait before retrying a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Determines whether to use client load balancing in attempts to connect to a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the protocol to be used. Can be socket or ssl. The default is socket. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information. The IBM WebSphere SequeLink JDBC driver only supports a value of socket.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Controls whether the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. Valid values are 1 and 0. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: transliterationWorkaroundServer
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Enables a workaround for transliteration. Valid settings are: 0, 1, 2. The default is 0 (disabled). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documenation for more information.

factories.name: Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server DataSource

resourceProperties.name: transliterationWorkaroundServer
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Enables a workaround for transliteration. Valid settings are: 0, 1, 2. The default is 0 (disabled). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documenation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The SequeLink JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

factories.name: Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server - 4.0 XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The SequeLink data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP address of the SequeLink server in dotted format or host name format.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: JDBC driver level trace attributes. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for a list of attributes.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: cipherSuites
resourceProperties.description: The Secure Socket Layer(SSL) cipher suites with which the SequeLink Java Client can use to connect. This property is required when networkProtocol=ssl.

resourceProperties.name: blockFetchForUpdate
resourceProperties.description: When the isolation level is ReadCommitted and a SELECT FOR UPDATE statement is issued against some data stores, the SequeLink Java Client does not lock the expected row. Default is 1 which does not lock the expected row.

resourceProperties.name: SLKStaticCursorLongColBuffLen
resourceProperties.description: The amount of data (in KB) that is buffered for SQL_LONGVARCHAR and SQL_LONGVARBINARY columns which an insensitive result set. Default is 4.

resourceProperties.name: certificateChecker
resourceProperties.description: The fully qualified class name of a user-defined server certificate checker class.

resourceProperties.name: serverDataSource
resourceProperties.description: A property that specifies a string to identify the server Data Source to be used for the connection. If unspecified, the configuration of the default server Data Source will be used for the connection.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false (by default), two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used.

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the application that is establishing the Connections. When the application does not provide a value, the default value is SequeLink JDBC Application.

resourceProperties.name: MSSMapLongToDecimal
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: ORANumber0IsNumeric
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: allowPrefetch
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. Enables the prefetch feature. When enabled, the JDBC driver requests a next set of rows from the server while the client is processing the previous set of rows. 0 = disable; 1 = enable.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Version 5.1 and beyond. The memory caching scheme for scroll-insensitive cursors. When set to 0, the driver uses a memory caching mechanism that does not use disk overflow. When set to a value greater than 0, data overflows to disk when the size of cached data exceeds the specified amount, specified in kilobytes. When set to a value less than 0, the data provider providers better performance. However, memory use may be affected.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers which can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The number of times to retry connections to a list of database servers (primary and alternate) until a successful connection is established. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: connectionRetryDelay
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. The number of seconds to wait before retrying a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: loadBalancing
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Determines whether to use client load balancing in attempts to connect to a list of database servers (primary and alternate). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the protocol to be used. Can be socket or ssl. The default is socket. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information. The IBM WebSphere SequeLink JDBC driver only supports a value of socket.

resourceProperties.name: resultsetMetaDataOptions
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Controls whether the driver performs additional processing and catalog queries needed to determine the correct table name for each result set column when the ResultSetMetaData.getTableName(), ResultSetMetaData.getSchemaName(), and ResultSetMetaData.getCatalogName() methods are called. Valid values are 1 and 0. See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: transliterationWorkaroundServer
resourceProperties.description: Version 6.1 and beyond. Enables a workaround for transliteration. Valid settings are: 0, 1, 2. The default is 0 (disabled). See the DataDirect SequeLink JDBC driver documenation for more information.

factories.name: Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.providerType: DataDirect SequeLink type 3 JDBC driver for MS SQL Server (XA)
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server XA DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The SequeLink data source for Microsoft SQL Server is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Driver for JDBC is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

factories.name: Deprecated - Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000 - 4.0 DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000 - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Driver for JDBC data source is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The name of the server where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Default value is cursor. Direct mode is more efficient, but it limits applications to a single active Statement while in a transaction. See the Microsoft driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect to the database. If this value is non-zero, the attempt to connect to the database will time out when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false (by default), two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used.

resourceProperties.name: netAddress
resourceProperties.description: The MAC address of the network interface card of the application connecting to SQL Server 2000. The supplied value appears in the net_address column of the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: programName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the application connecting to SQL Server 2000. The supplied value appears in the program_name column of the sysprocesses table.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. True means that string parameters are sent to SQL Server in Unicode. False means that they are sent in the default encoding, which can improve performance because the server does not need to convert Unicode characters to the default encoding. You should, however, use default encoding only if the parameter string data that you specify is consistent with the default encoding of the database. The default is true.

resourceProperties.name: WSID
resourceProperties.description: The workstation ID. Typically, this is the network name of the computer on which the application resides (optional). If specified, this value is stored in the master.dbo.sysprocesses column hostname and is returned by sp_who and the Transact-SQL HOST_NAME function.

factories.name: Deprecated - Microsoft JDBC driver for SQL Server 2000 DataSource
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Deprecated - Microsoft JDBC driver for SQL Server 2000 DataSource
factories.description: minVer null - depVer 6.0 - maxVer 6.1 - The Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Driver for JDBC data source is no longer provided as of version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: enable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Derby JDBC Provider
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 6.0.2 - maxVer null - Derby embedded non-XA JDBC Provider. This provider is only configurable in version 6.0.2 and later nodes

factories.name: Derby JDBC Driver DataSource
factories.description: minVer 6.0.2 - maxVer null - New JDBC Datasource. This Datasource type is only configurable in version 6.0.2 and later nodes

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This property must be set and it identifies which database to access. For example, g:/db/wombat.

resourceProperties.name: shutdownDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If set to the string 'shutdown', this will cause the database to shutdown when a java.sql.Connection object is obtained from the Data Source. E.g., If the Data Source is an XADataSource, a getXAConnection().getConnection() is necessary to cause the database to shutdown

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: Name for ConnectionPooledDataSource. Not used by the Data Source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: Description of the Data Source. Not used by the Data Source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: connectionAttributes
resourceProperties.description: Connection attributes specific to Derby. Please see the Derby documentation for a complete list of features.

resourceProperties.name: createDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If set to the string 'create', this will cause a new database of DatabaseName if that database does not already exist. The database is created when a connection object is obtained from the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Derby JDBC Provider (XA)
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 6.0.2 - maxVer null - Derby embedded XA JDBC Provider. This provider is only configurable in version 6.0.2 and later nodes

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: errorDetectionModel
resourceProperties.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resourceProperties.name: freeResourcesOnClose
resourceProperties.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.

resourceProperties.name: syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Use the time remaining (if any) in a JTA transaction as the default query timeout for SQL statements.

resourceProperties.name: userDefinedErrorMap
resourceProperties.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). Please refer to WebSphere Information Center for more details

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.

resourceProperties.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs
resourceProperties.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.

resourceProperties.name: connectionSharing
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).

resourceProperties.name: webSphereDefaultQueryTimeout
resourceProperties.description: Sets a default query timeout, which is the number of seconds (0 means infinite) that a SQL statement may execute before timing out. This default value is overridden during a JTA transaction if custom property syncQueryTimeoutWithTransactionTimeout is enabled.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Derby Network Server Using Universal JDBC Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: Derby Network Server Using Universal JDBC Driver
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 6.0.2 - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - Derby Network Server Provider using DB2 universal driver. This provider has been deprecated in version 6.1 of the application server. Do not use this provider in version 7 of the application server. Use the "Derby Network Server using Derby Client" instead.

factories.name: Derby Network Server DataSource
factories.providerType: Derby Network Server Using Universal JDBC Driver
factories.description: minVer 6.0.2 - depVer 6.1 - maxVer 6.1 - Data source for Derby Network Server using the DB2 Universal JDBC driver. This data source type has been deprecated and should only be used in version 6.0.2 nodes. It is not available in version 7.0 of the application server.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This property must be set and it identifies which database to access. For example, 'g:\\db\\wombat' or 'E:\\db2Sample\\newDBj;create=true'.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - Server hosting the Derby Server.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - The port number the Derby network Server is listening on.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: This is the driver type, only type4 is supported.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: The trace level for logging to the logWriter or trace file. Possible trace levels are: TRACE_NONE = 0,TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS = 1,TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS = 2,TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS = 4,TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION = 16,TRACE_CONNECTS = 32,TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS = 64,TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA = 128,TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA = 256,TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS = 512,TRACE_SQLJ = 1024,TRACE_ALL = -1, .

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: The trace file to store the trace output. If you specify the trace file, the DB2 Jcc trace will be logged in this trace file. If this property is not specified and the WAS.database trace group is enabled, then both WebSphere trace and JDBC driver trace will be logged into the WebSphere trace file.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting controls whether or not LOB locators are used to fetch LOB data. If enabled, LOB data is not streamed, but is fully materialized with locators when the user requests a stream on the LOB column. The default value is true. At this point Derby only supports true

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: This property provides a performance directive that affects the internal semantics of the input data type conversion capability of the driver. By default the Universal driver defers 'internal prepare requests'. In this case, the driver works without the benefit of described parameter or result set meta data until execute time. So undescsribed input data is sent 'as is' to the server without any data type cross-conversation of the inputs.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: reauthentication
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.

resourceProperties.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT CURRENT SQLID FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnection
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnection property instead. This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryCount property instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: Deprecated. Please use the validateNewConnectionRetryInterval instead. This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: nonTransactionalDataSource
resourceProperties.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: Derby Network Server Using Derby Client
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.providerType: Derby Network Server Using Derby Client
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: minVer 6.1 - maxVer null - Derby Network Server Provider that uses the Derby Client. This provider is only configurable in version 6.1 and later nodes

factories.name: Derby Network Server DS using Derby Client
factories.providerType: Derby Network Server Using Derby Client
factories.jndiName: jdbc/Derby Network Server DS using Derby Client
factories.description: minVer 6.1 - maxVer null - New Network Server JDBC Datasource that uses Derby Network Client. This Datasource type is only configurable in version 6.1 and later nodes

resourceProperties.name: createDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If configured to 'create' and if the databaseName does not already exist, this creates a new database when a connection is obtained from the data source.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: adminRequired=true - This is a required property. This property must be set and it identifies which database to access. For example, 'g:\\db\\wombat' or 'E:\\db2Sample\\newDBj;create=true'.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: Name for XADataSource. Not used by the data source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: Description of the Data Source. Not used by the Data Source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: Server hosting the Derby Server.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The port number the Derby network Server is listening on.

resourceProperties.name: securityMechanism
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a security mechanism for client access to the Network Server. Refer to the Derby Reference Manual for more information.

resourceProperties.name: shutdownDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If configured to 'shutdown', this causes the database to shut down when a connection is obtained from the data source.

resourceProperties.name: ssl
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the SSL mode of the client. The sslMode can be 'basic', 'peerAuthentication', or 'off' (the default). See 'Network encryption and authentication with SSL/TLS' in the Derby Server and Administration Guide for details.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: The trace level for logging to the logWriter or trace file. Possible trace levels are: TRACE_NONE = 0,TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS = 1,TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS = 2,TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS = 4,TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION = 16,TRACE_CONNECTS = 32,TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS = 64,TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA = 128,TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA = 256,TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS = 512,TRACE_ALL = -1, .

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: The trace file to store the trace output. If you specify the trace file, the derby trace will be logged in the specified trace file. If this property is not specified and the WAS.database trace group is enabled, then both WebSphere trace and JDBC driver trace will be logged into the WebSphere trace file.

resourceProperties.name: traceFileAppend
resourceProperties.description: Configures Derby Network Client to append trace to an existing trace file.

resourceProperties.name: traceDirectory
resourceProperties.description: Specifies a directory to which the Derby Network Client will send JDBC trace information. If the program or session has multiple connections, the Network Client creates a separate file for each connection. For more information about tracing, see 'Network client tracing' in the Derby Server and Administration Guide.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessageText
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.
